description: The underlying cause of CVE-2023-21740 relates to a vulnerability in the Windows Media component that allows remote code execution due to improper handling of specially crafted files. The exploitation of this vulnerability can occur locally, where an attacker could convince a user to open a malicious document, thereby executing arbitrary code on the system. The vulnerable components include various versions of Windows 10 and Windows 11, specifically builds such as 10.0.10240.20345 and 10.0.22000.2652. The impact of this flaw extends to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected components, as unauthorized users can gain access to sensitive information and modify system files. The relevant KB Articles addressing this issue include KB-5033379, KB-5033375, and KB-5033369, which provide the necessary updates to remedy the situation.
